alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Pawnee (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 11:37PM CDT until June 17 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN LANCASTER...SOUTHERN JOHNSON...NORTHWESTERN PAWNEE AND NORTHERN GAGE COUNTIES... At 1137 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles south of Adams, or 16 miles northeast of Beatrice, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Beatrice, Firth, Adams, Cortland, Clatonia, Hallam, Pickrell, Filley, Elk Creek, Lewiston, Virginia, Crab Orchard, Rockford, Vesta and Olive Creek State Recreation Area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
